title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 730.2 - Civil Appeals Management Program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 730.2 - Civil Appeals Management Program

State Regulations
(a) The chief clerk of the appellate
terms, in appropriate cases, may issue a notice directing the attorneys for the
parties and/or the parties themselves to attend a pre-argument conference
before a designated justice or other designated person, to consider the
possibility of settlement, the limitation of the issues, and any other matters
which the designated justice or other person determines may aid in the
disposition of the appeal or proceeding. (b) Any attorney or party who, without
good cause shown, fails to appear for a regularly scheduled pre-argument
conference, or who fails to comply with the terms of a stipulation or order
entered following a pre-argument conference, shall be subject to the imposition
of such costs and/or sanctions as the court may direct. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
730.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
